question: Which of the following was / were the objectives of the Indian States Committee in 1927?
option1: To chalkout the provinces of dominion of India
option2: To look into demands of the Indian princely states regarding autonomy
option3: To clarify the relationship between the paramount power and the Princely states
option4: To look into powers of the Viceroy and suggest measures to enhance them
answer: To clarify the relationship between the paramount power and the Princely states
explanation: To investigate and clarify the relationship between the paramount power and the Princes, the Government appointed the Indian States Committee in 1927. This committee was popularly known as the Butler Committee as Sir Harcourt Butler was its Chairman.
